Exporting Microsoft Project Tasks

If you have appropriate access rights, you can export Microsoft Project tasks to StarTeam after users have been synchronized. When tasks have been exported from Microsoft Project to StarTeam, the tasks are said to be linked.

These links can be reviewed on the upper pane of the project view window when the Task component is selected. Each task originally created in Microsoft Project is represented by an icon with a checkerboard pad on a clipboard.

It is important to be aware of the following restrictions:

  • Each Microsoft Project task may be exported to only one StarTeam project folder at one time. If you re-export a task, it is created in the new project location and deleted from the old location. It also loses its StarTeam work records. However, if the work record data has already been imported in Microsoft Project, the totals remain there and are not lost.

  • Individual tasks or entire branches of the Microsoft Project task hierarchy can be exported. In the later case, you must select the root tasks of those branches. Note:  Although you can selectively export individual tasks from the same task hierarchy to several different folders, this is not recommended because the StarTeam task hierarchy will then differ significantly from that of Microsoft Project.

  • Most of the data exported from a Microsoft Project task cannot be edited from StarTeam. For example, the Milestone and Priority check boxes are read-only for exported tasks, but editable for tasks created in StarTeam.

Note: You cannot export a task that has a blank name or a file attached to it as a note.

To export Microsoft Project tasks:

  1. From Microsoft Project, select one or more tasks to be exported.

  2. Select StarTeam > Export Tasks from the Microsoft Project menu bar.

    3. The Task Export Wizard: Currently Selected Task dialog appears. This dialog displays the name of the first selected task and whether or not it has subtasks. It also displays the description of the server you are using for the project. The rest of the text boxes are not applicable at this point in time.

    Note: If you have not synchronized users prior to exporting tasks, the server description will not be displayed in the StarTeam Server text box.

  3. Click Next. The Task Export Wizard: Select Project dialog appears.

  4. Select the server description. If you are not already logged onto the server configuration:

    1. The Log On to <server description name> dialog appears.

    2. Enter your user name and password in the appropriate text boxes.

    3. Click OK to return to the Task Export Wizard: Select Project dialog.

  5. Expand the server node.

  6. Select a project from the list, then click Next. The Task Export Wizard: Select View dialog appears.

  7. Select a view, then click Next. The Task Export Wizard: Select Folder dialog appears.

  8. Select a folder, then click Next. The Task Export to StarTeam dialog appears.

  9. Indicate what tasks you wish to export. Select one of the following options:

    • Selected tasks only (disabled if no task currently selected).

    • Selected task and children (disabled if no task currently selected or if the selected task has no children).

    • All unexported tasks in plan (default).

    • All tasks in plan (includes exported tasks). Select this option to place all tasks in new locations.

  10. Click Finish.

After a task has been exported from Microsoft Project to StarTeam, it cannot be moved or shared. Cutting and pasting is not recommended because cutting a task deletes it, and pasting creates a new task with a new ID. Although the task looks the same, the Microsoft Project Integration treats it as a new task. Dragging and dropping an exported task may also cause confusion, as the task may no longer be visible in StarTeam.
